The statewide governing body for athletics has determined these high-risk sports will move to March 2021. The first date of practice will be March 1st. Additional details are anticipated.

As of tonight, Soccer, Swim, Tennis and Cross-Country are still operational for a September 21st start. Please note this is still subject to change across our league, section and state. As we know, we will keep you informed.

Bob Breidenstein
Superintendent

Stay strong Warrior Nation,

Bob Breidenstein

Good afternoon seniors,

It is disappointing for me to share that the latest executive order from the governor is forcing us to change our plans for your graduation ceremony. Our Superintendent has spoken directly with the Governor‚Äôs office and has been told that the planned ceremony is in direct violation of his latest order. Both the Governor and Department of Health directives explicitly forbid in person and indoor graduation ceremonies.

We will continue to work hard and plan for a special graduation ceremony later this month. However, the ceremony scheduled for Saturday June 13th is being postponed. I will keep you posted with dates, venue and details through email and automated calls. Thank you for your understanding and I look forward to seeing you at the parade tonight.

We will celebrate soon!

Christopher Siebert
High School Principal

We are also very much indebted to Olean High student Nolan Hurlburt for not only printing out the headbands, but his diligence in troubleshooting our printers and improving the quality. His contribution has been huge.

Thanks also to the individuals who are donating to this effort!

Warriors! Two Reminders:

1). As our technology staff works on your devices we are taking several precautions to disinfect before during and after handling. Staff are wearing gloves as they work on each machine and will disinfect before returning.

b). Salamanca City Youth Center
c). Salamanca High School
d). Steamburg Community Center

You may pickup from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.
**If you are not able to get to one of the locations listed, please contact Mr. Ray Haley at 945-2404 ext. 6501 and ask for delivery!

#WeMissYou #WarriorNation #SalamancaProud

Congratulations to Prospect second-grader Darren Hayes on being our Kiwanis Terrific Kid of the Month!

Darren is always encouraging his cousin with Cerebral Palsy to practice walking and cheers him on when he goes for a long stretch. He is the first to volunteer to hold his hand and help support his cousin when they need to walk further than he is capable of doing on his own. Furthermore, Darren doesn‚Äôt complain if his cousin squeezes his hand too hard. Most important, Darren never treats his cousin differently than he would any other friend. Darren is incredibly thoughtful and one Terrific Kid.

This meeting, which is closed to the public, will be able to be viewed via live stream.

Janet L. Koch
District Clerk
